title.narrative: F.a: Bench Maj Promoting Education in Native Language

description.narrative: The project strengthens mother-tongue-based multilingual education in primary schools by developing school materials, strengthening the capacity of teachers, teacher trainers, dictionary workers and school inspectors as well as developing local languages a nd cultures. In Bench Maji Zone there are six local languages (bench, me'en, diizi, suri, shekko, baale), and the local government has decided that all of them can be used as language of instruction in the lower grades of primary education in each language area. The project aims to finalize the orthographic systems of the languages, prepare pertinent and contextualized study plans and materials and transition components to English and Amhara for higher grades. With the project the local language communitie s can better maintain their own language, history and culture, and develop their written culture. It also increases the possibilities of the members of these language communities for integration into the society and helps the children to improve their scho ol achievements. Out of the six languages, four were introduced in first and second grade pilot classes in the previous school year, and now the piloting continues in 3rd grade. The beneficiaries are the children and local people of six ethnic peoples, and the teachers and education authorities of the region. The implementing agency is SIL International (Summer Institute of Linguistics), with a long experience in developing written languages and strengthening mother-tongue-based multilingual education throu ghout the world.
